ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A simple HTTP client, with tools for making HTTP requests, and mocking HTTP requests. The package is built on R6, and takes inspiration from Ruby's 'faraday' gem (<https://rubygems.org/gems/faraday>). The package name is a play on curl, the widely used command line tool for HTTP, and this package is built on top of the R package 'curl', an interface to 'libcurl' (<https://curl.se/libcurl/>).

A simple HTTP client, with tools for making HTTP requests, and mocking HTTP requests. The package is built on R6, and takes inspiration from Ruby's 'faraday' gem (<https://rubygems.org/gems/faraday>). The package name is a play on curl, the widely used command line tool for HTTP, and this package is built on top of the R package 'curl', an interface to 'libcurl' (<https://curl.se/libcurl/>).

name: r-crul
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.6.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-crul
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/crul_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/crul/crul_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c58f77ea1b5aae7ad2c10d598d50b1269596d2d78ce1ee9a80e1aca2485c5c09

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r6 >=2.2.0
    - r-curl >=3.3
    - r-httpcode >=0.2.0
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-mime
    - r-rlang
    - r-urltools >=1.6.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r6 >=2.2.0
    - r-curl >=3.3
    - r-httpcode >=0.2.0
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-mime
    - r-rlang
    - r-urltools >=1.6.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('crul')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('crul')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://docs.ropensci.org/crul/, https://github.com/ropensci/crul, https://books.ropensci.org/http-testing/
  license: MIT
  summary: A simple HTTP client, with tools for making HTTP requests, and mocking HTTP requests.
    The package is built on R6, and takes inspiration from Ruby's 'faraday' gem (<https://rubygems.org/gems/faraday>).
    The package name is a play on curl, the widely used command line tool for HTTP,
    and this package is built on top of the R package 'curl', an interface to 'libcurl'
    (<https://curl.se/libcurl/>).
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - ocefpaf
